SEARCH
Package dev.strwbry.eventhorizon

Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.Scheduler
public class Scheduler extends Object
The Scheduler class manages the timing and execution of events in the EventHorizon plugin. It handles starting, pausing, resuming, and ending game sessions, as well as managing the event frequency.

    Stores the remaining time when a session is paused, -1 when not paused

  • Method Details

    • start

      public boolean start(int duration)
      Starts a new game timer with the specified duration.
      Parameters:
      duration - The duration of the game timer in seconds
      Returns:
      true if the session was successfully started, false if a session is already running

    • pause

      public boolean pause()
      Pauses the current game session.
      Returns:
      true if the session was successfully paused, false if no session is running or already paused

    • resume

      public boolean resume()
      Resumes a paused game session.
      Returns:
      true if the session was successfully resumed, false if no session exists or couldn't be started

    • end

      public boolean end()
      Ends the current game session.
      Returns:
      true if the session was successfully ended, false if no session was running

    • getRemainingTime

      public int getRemainingTime()
      Gets the remaining time in the current game session.
      Returns:
      the remaining time in seconds, or -1 if no session is active

    • reloadEventFrequency

      public void reloadEventFrequency()
      Reloads the event frequency from the configuration. This method updates the internal event frequency value by fetching the latest value from the plugin's configuration.
